@_SEAL_Org meets the demand for industry cooperation, creating a framework to confront and manage active threats.

üíï Wargames: A fundamental step in preparing protocols to face threats fast and decisively.‚Ä¶

SEAL addresses so many of the gaps in crypto security. 

First the 911 Emergency Helpdesk to connect users and researchers to the right contacts at protocols when they discover a potential exploit

Then Wargames to help protocols practice incident response before they have to‚Ä¶

I'm all for responsible disclosure but if the timeline is correct, this is a pretty ridiculous overreaction given that (1) Twitter didn't fix the bug for over a year and (2) rabbit only made public the XSS, not the full exploit chain

Besides, where do they report bugs now?

@shoucccc ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ

The bug has been fixed! Thanks again to @shoucccc for surfacing and credit to @rabbit_2333 for discovering

Technical Summary:
Reflected XSS in Twitter subdomain and CORS/CSP bypass allows for arbitrary requests to the Twitter API as locally authenticated user

They're still going around throwing multiple terabytes of traffic at projects running on Vercel, all with what seems like a common misconfiguration. If you or your friends get hit and need help mitigating, please reach out and spread the word
